tweet:
For 43 years, the #HydeAmendment has limited a woman's right to make her own reproductive decisions, denying critical services to women who need them the most & are unable to afford them.

No one should be denied access to a health service because of their income. #BeBoldEndHyde pic.twitter.com/LRzyk5yy16

The #AffordableCareAct is saving lives and making people healthier, despite the Trump Administration's ongoing attempts to dismantle it. 

I'll continue to fight to protect and strengthen the law. #ProtectOurCare https://wapo.st/2mTFC9u
Happy new year to all those in #CA07 celebrating #RoshHashanah. L'shana tova!
It’s past time for @senatemajldr to bring #HR1 up for a vote in the Senate. We need to fix our broken system - the American people have waited long enough.

It's been over 200 days since I voted to help pass #HR1, the For the People Act. 

This once-in-a-generation reform legislation would clean up corruption in Washington, get big money out of politics, protect the right to vote, and strengthen election security.
The President's actions are unprecedented. pic.twitter.com/PRA2SEdqEf
For 50 years, @NARAL has been a leader in the fight for reproductive freedom. I am proud to stand with them on this important anniversary. #NARAL50

In order to prevent future outbreaks, we must:

➡️ address the dangers of vaccine #misinformation
➡️ continue to urge our families and communities to get vaccinated
➡️ provide robust funding for #vaccine research and education efforts

#VaccinesWork
#Vaccines save 2 to 3 million lives annually. However, the CDC has reported that #measles cases in the U.S. have climbed to 1,241 in 2019, the greatest number of cases in the U.S. since 1992.

I joined @RepKimSchrier and leading physicians in hosting a press conference on the importance of #vaccines. 

The science is irrefutable: #VaccinesSaveLives. They are the safest and most effective tool we have for preventing infectious diseases. pic.twitter.com/Mcf603Eq8h

Yesterday, @RepZoeLofgren and I chaired the first-ever congressional hearing on the Trump Administration's #MuslimBan.

We can't let this policy fade from the spotlight. It continues to tear apart thousands of American families. https://wapo.st/2lzHL9D

Just wrapped up speaking with @kcranews on impeachment and the #UkraineTranscript.

Congress has the constitutional authority to hold the President accountable for his actions. pic.twitter.com/eYX1O9d7BW
Here's my statement on impeachment:  https://bera.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/rep-ami-bera-statement-on-impeachment … pic.twitter.com/rsOOPvX54B

TUNE IN as we're hearing directly from the families who are being negatively impacted by the Administration's #MuslimBan. 

It's important that we put a human face on this unnecessary policy. https://twitter.com/HouseJudiciary/status/1176497080988307456 …

The Administration's #MuslimBan waiver process is a chaotic black hole.

Americans, whose family members are trying to come to the United States, have spent years waiting for updates on the status of these waivers - to no avail. https://twitter.com/LeilaFadel/status/1176523199770587136 …

Unfortunately, there are thousands of stories like Omnia's across the country due to this burdensome and non-transparent waiver process under the #MuslimBan.

Today's hearing will be an important opportunity for the Administration to provide clear rationale behind its policy.

In my district, a two-year old named Omnia was separated from her parents for nine months because of the Administration's #MuslimBan. 

Read Omnia's story ⬇️: https://bit.ly/2XmKaWW

We know that America is at its best when it leads with dignity, compassion, and fairness. 

The Administration's #MuslimBan goes against the fundamental principles of our country. Put simply, it's un-American.

Tune in as I co-chair the first Congressional hearing on the Administration's #MuslimBan. @HouseForeign @HouseJudiciary @RepZoeLofgren
👀👇 https://twitter.com/HouseJudiciary/status/1176497080988307456 …

Inspired by the young people in #Sacramento and around the world who are demanding action at today’s #ClimateStrike. 🌎

Climate change poses an urgent threat to not only #California and the world, but to future generations. We have a responsibility to act to address this crisis. https://twitter.com/CapRadioNews/status/1175123558076338176 …

Today I met with Kristin Song whose son, Ethan, was killed by gun violence at the age of 15. 

Thank you, Kristin, for your courage and for sharing your story. We need to do more to #EndGunViolence and ensure the safety of our children. #EnoughIsEnough pic.twitter.com/FhdMbyRwuK

Happy 120th birthday to Dalip Singh Saund, our nation's first Asian American & Indian American member of Congress. I am honored to follow in the footsteps of this extraordinary public servant. He is an inspiration to generations of Asian Americans, Californians, & all Americans. pic.twitter.com/U1eUT1D0mk

Congrats to Lisa for winning the #CA07 Photo Contest! 📸🥳

Her photo of the Effie Yeaw Nature Center in #Carmichael is our new Facebook cover photo. This photo and all the outstanding entries are a great reminder that #CA07 is one of the most beautiful places to call home.  https://twitter.com/RepBera/status/1171865650291257344 … pic.twitter.com/H8RHIr332s

Great to speak with @HalaGorani and @cnni.

We discussed:
✅the President's new National Security Adviser
✅the latest on #Iran
✅the Administration revoking #California's auto emissions waiver.

👀👇 https://bit.ly/2mkAkCZ

No, they won’t. 

This is just another attempt by President Trump to take on #California, which has led the country in #climate and #environmental policies. California's auto emissions waiver created jobs and kept families safe and healthy. Revoking this is a step backwards. https://twitter.com/sacbee_news/status/1174394703082602497 …

It's been over 200 days since I cast my vote for #HR8, the Bipartisan Background Checks Act. This legislation is bipartisan, commonsense, and would help save lives.

It's past time for @senatemajldr and the Senate to pass #HR8. Americans are waiting. ⏱️⏳
Congratulations to @RiverCats on winning their third Triple-A championship! ⚾️🏆🎉 https://twitter.com/RiverCats/status/1174154527462842368 …

The conditions we saw at the border highlighted the urgent need for enhanced infection control, including #vaccinations at initial medical screenings.

We put every community at risk when we fail to take basic steps to protect #PublicHealth.
All three of us have visited border facilities in #Texas. One of our main takeaways as doctors and policymakers was that the overcrowded conditions are ripe for a public health emergency.

#ICYMI - I joined @RepKimSchrier & @CongressmanRuiz in writing to the Administration to express our concerns about recent reports that migrant families will not be receiving flu vaccines this Fall. https://cbsn.ws/2lXffP3

My staff is hosting #CA07 office hours tomorrow at Rancho Cordova Library. They're here to help with any issues you're having with Social Security, Medicare, Medicaid, and more. 

Learn more and RSVP: 👇
 https://bera.house.gov/upcomingevents  pic.twitter.com/kykzRmf3nj

Thank you to all the students and families who came out to our annual Service Academy Information Day this weekend! #CA07

If you’d like more info on how to apply to our nation’s Service Academies, please visit:  https://bera.house.gov/academynominations … pic.twitter.com/GMpOUDf0Ax

Unfortunately, like so many other important pieces of legislation, @senatemajldr and the Senate has refused to even hold a vote on #VAWA.

For decades, #VAWA has been a bipartisan issue. Survivors need the Senate to pass this bill! pic.twitter.com/I32WCGnygF

Today marks the 25th anniversary of #VAWA, the Violence Against Women Act. This landmark legislation has led our nation's response to the epidemics of domestic violence, sexual assault, dating violence, and stalking. #VAWA25 

I was proud to vote to reauthorize #VAWA in April. pic.twitter.com/v5SJZ9OLfR
Great story from #CA07! 📚📚 https://twitter.com/kcranews/status/1172231467340107777 …

✅✅
#ICYMI - Proud to have voted yesterday to protect California's coast from offshore oil and gas drilling. We must work towards a clean energy future that creates 21st century jobs while keeping our environment clean and safe. #ProtectOurCoast pic.twitter.com/hEoE4cu94Z
It's time for @senatemajldr to #DoSomething to end gun violence. Inaction is unacceptable. https://twitter.com/nytimes/status/1172073202476093440 …

The finalists are in!📸

Thank you to everyone who entered my #CA07 District Photo Contest. You have until Tuesday, Sept. 17th to vote by liking your favorite entry. The winning photo will be feature on my website and social media accounts.

✅Vote here👉  https://www.facebook.com/pg/RepAmiBera/photos/?tab=album&album_id=2705613286118418 … pic.twitter.com/khyEu7N7lb

My staff is hosting #CA07 office hours today at the @saclib Bookmobile in Rancho Murieta. They're here to help with any issues you're having with Social Security, Medicare, Medicaid, and more. More info:  https://bera.house.gov/upcomingevents 

Stop by and say hi! 👋👋 pic.twitter.com/5ZHiwHZSQI

The uninsured rate has increased for the first time since the Affordable Care Act took full effect in 2014. The Trump Administration's assault on #HealthCare is having a real and negative impact on the lives of the American people. #ProtectOurCare https://bit.ly/2lLroGJ
18 years ago, our nation was changed forever. Today we remember and mourn those we lost on 9/11, their families, and our brave first responders. We will #NeverForget. https://nyti.ms/2mbOnuJ

I joined @NewDemCoalition today in meeting with @SecAzar to discuss #HealthCare and #DrugPrices. 

We must take action to lower the costs of both. pic.twitter.com/s15gE9hQli

I helped pass #HR8, the Bipartisan Background Checks Act, and #HR1112, the Enhanced Background Checks Act, back in February. 

It’s past time for @SenateMajLdr and the Senate to #DoSomething and pass these lifesaving measures. #EndGunViolence pic.twitter.com/JB5iqfvNbT
Enjoyed touring the @SanJuanWtrDist Water Treatment Plant in #CA07, which provides drinking water to many parts of #SacramentoCounty. pic.twitter.com/iPXQ5vgumn

Interested in attending a military service academy? 🎖️ 

Every year, I nominate hardworking students to our nation's military academies. My office is hosting an Information Day on Sept. 14th for students to learn more. https://bera.house.gov/media-center/amis-updates/service-academy-information-day …

As a doctor, I know the toll that stressful situations take on first responders’ mental health. That’s why I introduced the HERO Act, to make mental health counseling and resources more available to help first responders. http://bit.ly/2k7ZPH7

This week is #NationalSuicidePreventionWeek. Mental health conditions affect 1 in 5 Americans each year, Congress needs to ensure that mental health services are available & effective. We must remove the stigma around mental illness so no one is ashamed to get the help they need.

Enjoyed speaking with employees from AMPAC in #CA07. We discussed how to keep talent in #SacramentoCounty after students graduate college and how to create more highly skilled manufacturing jobs, like the ones at AMPAC. pic.twitter.com/RDIqi0ciDc

Tomorrow is the deadline to submit your photos for the #CA07 District Photo Contest! Winning photos will be featured on my website and social media pages.📸

More information on how to submit your photos ➡️ https://bera.house.gov/photocontest  pic.twitter.com/EKcAjsFidl

Meet Bill Davies, a 91-year-old WWII veteran who raised money to install a veteran's wall and flag pole at Oakmont of Carmichael senior living facility. 

I was honored to present Bill with a flag that was flown over the Capitol. Thank you Bill and all veterans for your service. pic.twitter.com/oCsnhcpNlX

Today marks two years since President Trump ended #DACA.

Like towns and cities across America, #CA07 is home to #Dreamers and #DACA recipients. They are our neighbors, friends, teachers, and first responders. 

That's why I'll continue to fight to #ProtectTheDream. pic.twitter.com/st5GmKH2fn

I joined colleagues in condemning the President's decision to move $155 million from the #FEMA disaster relief fund to pay for #ICE detention beds. 

With #California at the height of fire season and #HurricaneDorian hitting the east coast, diverting these funds are unacceptable. pic.twitter.com/eFxRom75S3

I joined @AssemblyDems today in #Sacramento to denounce the Trump Administration's recent actions against immigrants and asylum seekers. 

America is a nation of immigrants and our diversity is one of our greatest strengths. pic.twitter.com/JJvtqwx7ks

Thank you to everyone in #CA07 who came out to our town hall last night at Florin High School!

It was an engaging and productive discussion - thank you for your questions and ideas. pic.twitter.com/20glmVPlxR – at Florin High School
